info.description: Our API uses a REST based design, leverages the JSON data format, and relies upon HTTPS for transport. We respond with meaningful HTTP response codes and if an error occurs, we include error details in the response body.  API Documentation is at https://api.youneedabudget.com
info.title: YNAB API Endpoints

tags.name: Payee Locations
tags.description: When you enter a transaction and specify a payee on the YNAB mobile apps, the GPS coordinates for that location are stored, with your permission, so that the next time you are in the same place (like the Grocery store) we can pre-populate nearby payees for you!  Itâ€™s handy and saves you time.  This resource makes these locations available.  Locations will not be available for all payees.

tags.name: Months
tags.description: Each budget contains one or more months, which is where To be Budgeted, Age of Money and category (budgeted / activity / balances) amounts are available.

tags.name: Scheduled Transactions
tags.description: The scheduled transactions for a budget

get.description: Returns budgets list with summary information
Returns a single budget with all related entities.  This resource is effectively a full budget export.

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.name: last_knowledge_of_server
parameters.description: The starting server knowledge.  If provided, only entities that have changed since last_knowledge_of_server will be included.

404.description: The specified budget was not found

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.description: The id of the account

404.description: The requested account was not found

get.description: Returns all categories grouped by category group.  Amounts (budgeted, activity, balance, etc.) are specific to the current budget month (UTC).

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

200.description: The categories grouped by category group

get.description: Returns a single category.  Amounts (budgeted, activity, balance, etc.) are specific to the current budget month (UTC).

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: The id of the category

get.summary: Single category for a specific budget month
get.description: Returns a single category for a specific budget month.  Amounts (budgeted, activity, balance, etc.) are specific to the current budget month (UTC).

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: The budget month in ISO format (e.g. 2016-12-01) ("current" can also be used to specify the current calendar month (UTC))

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: The id of the category

404.description: The month category was not was found

parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.description: The id of the category

parameters.name: month_category
parameters.description: The month category to update

200.description: The month category was successfully updated

400.description: The request could not be understood due to malformed syntax or validation error(s)

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.name: since_date
parameters.description: If specified, only transactions on or after this date will be included.  The date should be ISO formatted (e.g. 2016-12-30).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: If specified, only transactions of the specified type will be included. 'uncategorized' and 'unapproved' are currently supported.

parameters.name: last_knowledge_of_server
parameters.description: The starting server knowledge.  If provided, only entities that have changed since last_knowledge_of_server will be included.

post.summary: Create a single transaction or multiple transactions
post.description: Creates a single transaction or multiple transactions.  If you provide a body containing a 'transaction' object, a single transaction will be created and if you provide a body containing a 'transactions' array, multiple transactions will be created.

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The transaction or transactions to create.  To create a single transaction you can specify a value for the 'transaction' object and to create multiple transactions you can specify an array of 'transactions'.  It is expected that you will only provide a value for one of these objects.

201.description: The transaction or transactions were successfully created

400.description: The request could not be understood due to malformed syntax or validation error(s).

409.description: A transaction on the same account with the same import_id already exists.

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The transactions to update.  Optionally, transaction 'id' value(s) can be specified as null and an 'import_id' value can be provided which will allow transaction(s) to updated by their import_id.

400.description: The request could not be understood due to malformed syntax or validation error(s).

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: The id of the transaction

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: The id of the transaction

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The transaction to update

400.description: The request could not be understood due to malformed syntax or validation error(s)

post.description: Creates multiple transactions.  Although this endpoint is still supported, it is recommended to use 'POST /budgets/{budget_id}/transactions' to create multiple transactions.

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.name: transactions
parameters.description: The list of transactions to create

201.description: The bulk request was processed sucessfully

400.description: The request could not be understood due to malformed syntax or validation error(s)

get.description: Returns all transactions for a specified account

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The id of the account

parameters.name: since_date
parameters.description: If specified, only transactions on or after this date will be included.  The date should be ISO formatted (e.g. 2016-12-30).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: If specified, only transactions of the specified type will be included. 'uncategorized' and 'unapproved' are currently supported.

parameters.name: last_knowledge_of_server
parameters.description: The starting server knowledge.  If provided, only entities that have changed since last_knowledge_of_server will be included.

parameters.name: since_date

parameters.description: If specified, only transactions of the specified type will be included. 'uncategorized' and 'unapproved' are currently supported.

parameters.name: last_knowledge_of_server
parameters.description: The starting server knowledge.  If provided, only entities that have changed since last_knowledge_of_server will be included.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: If specified, only transactions of the specified type will be included. 'uncategorized' and 'unapproved' are currently supported.

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

200.description: The list of requested scheduled transactions

parameters.name: budget_id
parameters.description: The id of the budget ("last-used" can also be used to specify the last used budget)

parameters.name: scheduled_transaction_id
parameters.description: The id of the scheduled transaction

404.description: The scheduled transaction was not found

DateFormat.description: The date format setting for the budget.  In some cases the format will not be available and will be specified as null.

CurrencyFormat.description: The currency format setting for the budget.  In some cases the format will not be available and will be specified as null.

last_modified_on.description: The last time any changes were made to the budget from either a web or mobile client.

type.description: The type of account. Note: payPal, merchantAccount, investmentAccount, and mortgage types have been deprecated and will be removed in the future.

on_budget.description: Whether this account is on budget or not

closed.description: Whether this account is closed or not

balance.description: The current balance of the account in milliunits format

cleared_balance.description: The current cleared balance of the account in milliunits format

uncleared_balance.description: The current uncleared balance of the account in milliunits format

transfer_payee_id.description: The payee id which should be used when transferring to this account

deleted.description: Whether or not the account has been deleted.  Deleted accounts will only be included in delta requests.

hidden.description: Whether or not the category group is hidden

deleted.description: Whether or not the category group has been deleted.  Deleted category groups will only be included in delta requests.

categories.description: Category group categories.  Amounts (budgeted, activity, balance, etc.) are specific to the current budget month (UTC).

hidden.description: Whether or not the category is hidden

original_category_group_id.description: If category is hidden this is the id of the category group it originally belonged to before it was hidden.

goal_type.description: The type of goal, if the cagegory has a goal (TB=Target Category Balance, TBD=Target Category Balance by Date, MF=Monthly Funding)

goal_creation_month.description: The month a goal was created

goal_target.description: The goal target amount in milliunits

goal_target_month.description: If the goal type is 'TBD' (Target Category Balance by Date), this is the target month for the goal to be completed

goal_percentage_complete.description: The percentage completion of the goal

deleted.description: Whether or not the category has been deleted.  Deleted categories will only be included in delta requests.

transfer_account_id.description: If a transfer payee, the account_id to which this payee transfers to

deleted.description: Whether or not the payee has been deleted.  Deleted payees will only be included in delta requests.
Whether or not the payee location has been deleted.  Deleted payee locations will only be included in delta requests.

amount.description: The transaction amount in milliunits format

payee_name.description: The payee name.  If a payee_name value is provided and payee_id has a null value, the payee_name value will be used to resolve the payee by either (1) a matching payee rename rule (only if import_id is also specified) or (2) a payee with the same name or (3) creation of a new payee.

category_id.description: The category for the transaction.  Split and Credit Card Payment categories are not permitted and will be ignored if supplied.  If an existing transaction has a Split category it cannot be changed.

cleared.description: The cleared status of the transaction

approved.description: Whether or not the transaction is approved.  If not supplied, transaction will be unapproved by default.

import_id.description: If specified for a new transaction, the transaction will be treated as Imported and assigned this import_id.  If another transaction on the same account with this same import_id is later attempted to be created, it will be skipped to prevent duplication.  Transactions imported through File Based Import or Direct Import and not through the API, are assigned an import_id in the format: 'YNAB:[milliunit_amount]:[iso_date]:[occurrence]'.  For example, a transaction dated 2015-12-30 in the amount of -$294.23 USD would have an import_id of 'YNAB:-294230:2015-12-30:1'.  If a second transaction on the same account was imported and had the same date and same amount, its import_id would be 'YNAB:-294230:2015-12-30:2'.  Using a consistent format will prevent duplicates through Direct Import and File Based Import.  If import_id is specified as null, the transaction will be treated as a user entered transaction.

transaction_ids.description: The transaction ids that were saved

transaction.description: If a single transaction was specified, the transaction that was saved

transactions.description: If multiple transactions were specified, the transactions that were saved

duplicate_import_ids.description: If multiple transactions were specified, a list of import_ids that were not were created because of an existing import_id found on the same account

amount.description: The transaction amount in milliunits format

cleared.description: The cleared status of the transaction

approved.description: Whether or not the transaction is approved

transfer_account_id.description: If a transfer transaction, the account to which it transfers

transfer_transaction_id.description: If a transfer transaction, the id of transaction on the other side of the transfer

matched_transaction_id.description: If transaction is matched, the id of the matched transaction

import_id.description: If the Transaction was imported, this field is a unique (by account) import identifier.  If this transaction was imported through File Based Import or Direct Import and not through the API, the import_id will have the format: 'YNAB:[milliunit_amount]:[iso_date]:[occurrence]'.  For example, a transaction dated 2015-12-30 in the amount of -$294.23 USD would have an import_id of 'YNAB:-294230:2015-12-30:1'.  If a second transaction on the same account was imported and had the same date and same amount, its import_id would be 'YNAB:-294230:2015-12-30:2'.

deleted.description: Whether or not the transaction has been deleted.  Deleted transactions will only be included in delta requests.

subtransactions.description: If a split transaction, the subtransactions.

type.description: Whether the hybrid transaction represents a regular transaction or a subtransaction

parent_transaction_id.description: For subtransaction types, this is the id of the pararent transaction.  For transaction types, this id will be always be null.

transaction_ids.description: The list of Transaction ids that were created.

duplicate_import_ids.description: If any Transactions were not created because they had an import_id matching a transaction already on the same account, the specified import_id(s) will be included in this list.

amount.description: The subtransaction amount in milliunits format

transfer_account_id.description: If a transfer, the account_id which the subtransaction transfers to

deleted.description: Whether or not the subtransaction has been deleted.  Deleted subtransactions will only be included in delta requests.

date_first.description: The first date for which the Scheduled Transaction was scheduled.

date_next.description: The next date for which the Scheduled Transaction is scheduled.

amount.description: The scheduled transaction amount in milliunits format

transfer_account_id.description: If a transfer, the account_id which the scheduled transaction transfers to

deleted.description: Whether or not the scheduled transaction has been deleted.  Deleted scheduled transactions will only be included in delta requests.

subtransactions.description: If a split scheduled transaction, the subtransactions.

amount.description: The scheduled subtransaction amount in milliunits format

transfer_account_id.description: If a transfer, the account_id which the scheduled subtransaction transfers to

deleted.description: Whether or not the scheduled subtransaction has been deleted.  Deleted scheduled subtransactions will only be included in delta requests.

income.description: The total amount in transactions categorized to 'Inflow: To be Budgeted' in the month

budgeted.description: The total amount budgeted in the month

activity.description: The total amount in transactions in the month, excluding those categorized to 'Inflow: To be Budgeted'

to_be_budgeted.description: The available amount for 'To be Budgeted'

age_of_money.description: The Age of Money as of the month

categories.description: The budget month categories.  Amounts (budgeted, activity, balance, etc.) are specific to the {month} parameter specified.
